title: Kemira acquires specialty chemicals firm Soto Industries in US
text:
Kemira acquires specialty chemicals firm Soto Industries in US 3 September 2015 Print Email 
Finnish chemicals firm Kemira has acquired North Carolina-based privately owned company Soto Industries. 
Soto offers specialty chemicals and services, including scale control products, defoamers, and settling agents for the pulp and paper industry. 
Kemira Americas paper segment senior vice-president Billy Ford said: "The Soto Industries acquisition is another example of Kemira's dedication to the pulp and paper industry, as well as Kemira's commitment to execute our global growth strategy via continued investment into our paper segment." 
The company expects the transaction to have no material impact on its financial results. 
Kemira primarily serves customers in water-intensive industries with expertise, application know-how, and chemicals. The company also caters to the pulp and paper, oil and gas, mining, and water treatment segments. "The Soto Industries acquisition is an example of Kemira's dedication to the pulp and paper industry." 
Last year, Kemira recorded revenues of €2.1bn. It employs approximately 4,250 people. 
For the first six months of this year, the company's revenue increased 10% to €1.1bn, with a 20% increase in operating earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation, and amortisation (EBITDA) to €141.1m. 
The latest acquisition comes after Kemira opened a water treatment chemicals plant in Catalonia, Spain in June. 
Said to be one of the largest of such production plants in Europe, the facility features a unit to manufacture sizing agents used in the pulp and paper industry. 
Earlier this year, the company also completed the acquisition of AkzoNobel's global paper chemicals business in a €153m deal.
